intro: Rhaphiolepis herae, commonly known as the Japanese rosebay, is a flowering shrub native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and is well-suited to well-drained, acidic soils. It produces small, elliptical leaves that are glossy and provide a striking contrast to its vibrant floral displays. Rhaphiolepis herae is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and landscapes.
